Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk python-kdcproxy
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: new package: python-kdcproxy
Vulnerability.Description:
A new python-kdcproxy package is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. The python-kdcproxy package contains a Python 2.x Web Server Gateway Interface (WSGI) module, which serves as a proxy for KDC requests over HTTP by following the Microsoft Kerberos KDC Proxy Protocol (MS-KKDCP).
This enhancement update adds the python-kdcproxy package to Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7. (BZ#1206310)
Note: If you have the python-kdcproxy package already installed on your system, such as from the Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux (EPEL) repository, you must restart the httpd service for the changes in this updated version to take effect.
All users who require python-kdcproxy are advised to install this new package.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
